description.narrative: At least 75% of children diagnosed with severe acute malnutrition recover following adequate treatment. At least 50% of children under-2 years benefit from interventions to prevent or reduce stunting and at least 50% of mothers reached with behaviour change interventions to improve the rate of exclusive breast feeding in target regions by the end of 2014.

sector.narrative: Birth Registration/Civil Registration and Vital Statistics systems
Breastfeeding protection, promotion and support (including work on Code)
Parenting Programme to promote nurturing care and early stimulation
Public health emergencies, including disease outbreaks
Relief co-ordination, protection and support services
Technical assistance - Treatment of severe acute malnutrition
Vitamin A supplementation in early childhood (children under 5)

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities emergency relief
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

title.narrative: Madagascar United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2018 Madagascar: Impact Evaluation of Fiavota Phase 1 Emergency and Recovery Cash Transfer in Madagascar
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: At least 75% of children diagnosed with severe acute malnutrition recover following adequate treatment. At least 50% of children under-2 years benefit from interventions to prevent or reduce stunting and at least 50% of mothers reached with behaviour change interventions to improve the rate of exclusive breast feeding in target regions by the end of 2014.

% of Fokontany in the target zones with at least one Community Health worker trained in providing counselling on young and infant child feeding and maternal nutrition (with a focus on exclusive breastfeeding) using the new UNICEF modules (Analanjirofo, Vakinankaratra, Menabe,Anosy,Tana city)

% of CSBs (Health centers) in the target zones with at least one health worker trained in providing counselling on infant and young child feeding and maternal nutrition (with a focus on exclusive breastfeeding) using the new UNICEF modules (Analanjirofo, Vakinankaratra, Menabe,Anosy,Tana city)
% of estimated severly malnourished children admited for treatment - national
% of pregnant women reached with iron folic /acid
% of children under 5 admited for treatment of severe acute malnutrtion who are dischared as "recovered" - national
% of children aged 6-59 months reached with vitamin A supplement
% of children 12 - 59 month reached with deworming
% of villages in the target zoness covered by multiple micronutenet for home fortification of complementary food for children 6-23 months (Analanjirofo, Vakinankaratra, Menabe,Anosy,Tana city)
